issue.title: model: Rename directory property to location

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

issue.body:
# Support Archive Storage for Models

The goal of this project is the modify Models and DataFlows to support saving
and loading from archives (such as `.zip` and `.tar` for example).

Currently all DFFML models have a `directory` property, which is where they
store the contents of the model's state. It does not currently hold a copy of
the model's config.

We'll want to modify the Model's context entry and exit code to have it
pack/unpack it's config and its saved state directory from/into the archive at
`location`.

## Skills

- Python

## Difficulty

Beginner/Intermediate

## Related Readings

- https://intel.github.io/dffml/master/docs/contributing/gsoc/2021/

## Getting Started

- Read the contributing guidelines
  - https://intel.github.io/dffml/master/contributing/index.html
- Go through the quickstart
  - https://intel.github.io/dffml/master/quickstart/model.html
- Go trough the model tutorials
  - https://intel.github.io/dffml/master/tutorials/models/
- Go through the model plugins
  - https://intel.github.io/dffml/master/plugins/dffml_model.html
- Start programming to understand better what will need to happen. The following
  is a rough guide meant to give you some activities that will help you better
  understand what needs to be done so you can write a more complete proposal.
  - Rename the `directory` property to `location` for all models.
  - On `__aenter__()` of `dffml.model.model.Model`, if `location` has an
    extension, such as zip or tar, extract it to a temporary directory.
  - Write a method, `get_directory()`, which returns the location of the
    temporary directory property on the `Model` class.
  - On `__aexit__()` , pack the model state directory into the `location`, along
    with it's config.
  - Understand where all the code for models are that will potentially need to
    be changed (`dffml/model` and `model/`)
  - Make this work with test cases for the SLR model.

## Potential Mentors

- [John Andersen](https://github.com/pdxjohnny)
- [Yash Lamba](https://github.com/yashlamba)
- [Saksham Arora](https://github.com/sakshamarora1)

## Tracking and Discussion

This project is related to the following issues. Please discuss and ask
questions in the issue comments. Please also ping mentors on
[Gitter](https://gitter.im/dffml/community) when you post on the following
issues so that they are sure to see that you've commented.

- https://github.com/intel/dffml/issues/662

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.

body:
It look like we might still be missing a few:

```console
$ git grep -A 35 -E 'dffml train|dffml accuracy|dffml predict' | python -c 'import sys; print("--".join([i for i in sys.stdin.read().split("--") if not "model-directory" in i]).strip())'
--------------------------------+---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-| Type           | Model                           | Entrypoint         | Architecture                                                                   |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-+================+=================================+====================+================================================================================+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-| Classification | AlexNet                         | alexnet            | `AlexNet architecture <https://arxiv.org/abs/1404.5997>`_                      |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | DenseNet-121                    | densenet121        | `DenseNet architecture <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1608.06993.pdf>`_                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | DenseNet-161                    | densenet161        |                                                                                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | DenseNet-169                    | densenet169        |                                                                                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | DenseNet-201                    | densenet201        |                                                                                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | MnasNet 0.5                     | mnasnet0_5         | `MnasNet architecture <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1807.11626.pdf>`_                 |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | MnasNet 1.0                     | mnasnet1_0         |                                                                                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | MobileNet V2                    | mobilenet_v2       | `MobileNet V2 architecture <https://arxiv.org/abs/1801.04381>`_                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | VGG-11                          | vgg11              | `VGG-11 architecture Configuration "A" <https://arxiv.org/pdf/1409.1556.pdf>`_ |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                | VGG-11 with batch normalization | vgg11_bn           |                                                                                |
model/pytorch/dffml_model_pytorch/__init__.py-|                +---------------------------------+--------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
----------------+-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-| Type           | Model                         | Entrypoint     | Parameters                                                                                                                                                                                    |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-+================+===============================+================+===============================================================================================================================================================================================+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-| Regression     | LinearRegression              | scikitlr       | `scikitlr <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression.html#sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression/>`_                                             |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | ElasticNet                    | scikiteln      | `scikiteln <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.ElasticNet.html#sklearn.linear_model.ElasticNet/>`_                                                        |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | RandomForestRegressor         | scikitrfr      | `scikitrfr <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.ensemble.RandomForestRegressor.html>`_                                                                                  |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | BayesianRidge                 | scikitbyr      | `scikitbyr <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.BayesianRidge.html#sklearn.linear_model.BayesianRidge/>`_                                                  |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | Lasso                         | scikitlas      | `scikitlas <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.Lasso.html#sklearn.linear_model.Lasso/>`_                                                                  |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | ARDRegression                 | scikitard      | `scikitard <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.ARDRegression.html#sklearn.linear_model.ARDRegression/>`_                                                  |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | RANSACRegressor               | scikitrsc      | `scikitrsc <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.RANSACRegressor.html#sklearn.linear_model.RANSACRegressor/>`_                                              |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | DecisionTreeRegressor         | scikitdtr      | `scikitdtr <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.tree.DecisionTreeRegressor.html#sklearn.tree.DecisionTreeRegressor/>`_                                                  |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | GaussianProcessRegressor      | scikitgpr      | `scikitgpr <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.gaussian_process.GaussianProcessRegressor.html#sklearn.gaussian_process.GaussianProcessRegressor/>`_                    |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | OrthogonalMatchingPursuit     | scikitomp      | `scikitomp <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.OrthogonalMatchingPursuit.html#sklearn.linear_model.OrthogonalMatchingPursuit/>`_                          |
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                +-------------------------------+----------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/__init__.py-|                | Lars                          | scikitlars     | `scikitlars <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.linear_model.Lars.html#sklearn.linear_model.Lars/>`_                                                                   |
--
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh:dffml accuracy \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -model spacyner \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -sources s=op \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -source-opimp model.spacy.dffml_model_spacy.ner.utils:parser \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -source-args train.json False \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -model-model_name_or_path en_core_web_sm \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -model-output_dir temp \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -model-n_iter 5 \
model/spacy/examples/ner/accuracy.sh-  -log debug

```

- [x] spacy `output_dir` should be re-named to `directory`
- [ ] transformers `output_dir` should be re-named to `directory`

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.
